dmca.title: INFRINGMENT CONCERNING www.patches4less.com
dmca.body:
Dear Mr. McDonald

My law firm is  intellectual property counsel for (company name)your former employer, and the owner of the domain name and common law trademark www.patches4less.com. my purpose in writing you is to extend to you a one time short term opportunity to avoid litigation over infringing use of the confusingly similar domain name www.patches-4-less.com. this offer will not be renewed.

As you know you were employed at (company name) from (date)-(date) at which point you let your employment purportedly to pursue other interests, and with the intention of honoring your convent not to compete(company name) has learned however that you not only went into direct competition with  in violation of your non-compete agreement and at a physical address only a short distance away in (city) but also that you have adopted and are using the intentionally confusing similar name www.patches-4-less.com for purposes of this competition. as any judge would readily appreciate your choice of domain names was not coincidental; it was predatory a calculated effort to draw customers away from your former employer and to trade on your former employer's name reputation and good will for your own personal advantage. This conduct must stop.

you are doubtless aware that your competition is a violation of the restrictive covenant which you excuted when you began your employment at (company name)But its more than that it is a violation of section 42a of the Lanham Act............you have 48 hrs to comply  or we shall file suit for damages,attorneys fees, and other appropriate relief.
